intro: Euphrasia exaristata, commonly known as the narrow-leaved eyebright, is a flowering plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the Scrophulariaceae family and is characterized by its small, yellowish flowers and narrow, lance-shaped leaves. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. It is known for its medicinal properties, with historical use in treating eye conditions and respiratory ailments. Euphrasia exaristata is also valued in horticulture for its delicate appearance and ability to thrive in partial shade.
